00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomExample.cpp
00003  * \brief Simple examples of use of %RandomLib
00004  *
00005  * Compile/link with, e.g.,\n
00006  * g++ -I../include -O2 -funroll-loops
00007  *   -o RandomExample RandomExample.cpp ../src/Random.cpp\n
00008  * ./RandomExample
00009  *
00010  * This provides a simple illustration of some of the capabilities of
00011  * %RandomLib.
00012  *
00013  * $Id: 5ec386fb8d3185e42849f949328ccde86157b8bd $
00014  *
00015  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2006-2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00016  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00017  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00018  **********************************************************************/
00019 
00020 #include <iostream>
00021 #include <vector>
00022 #include <string>
00023 #include <algorithm>
00024 #include <RandomLib/Random.hpp>
00025 #include <RandomLib/NormalDistribution.hpp>
00026 #include <RandomLib/RandomSelect.hpp>
00027 
00028 int main(int, char**) {
00029   RandomLib::Random r;          // Create r
00030   r.Reseed();                   // and give it a unique seed
00031   std::cout << "Using " << r.Name() << "\n"
00032             << "with seed " << r.SeedString() << "\n";
00033   {
00034     std::cout << "Estimate pi = ";
00035     size_t in = 0, num = 10000;
00036     for (size_t i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
00037       // x, y are in the interval (-1/2,1/2)
00038       double x = r.FixedS(), y = r.FixedS();
00039       if (x * x + y * y < 0.25) ++in; // Inside the circle
00040     }
00041     std::cout << (4.0 * in) / num << "\n";
00042   }
00043   {
00044     std::cout << "Tossing a coin 20 times: ";
00045     for (size_t i = 0; i < 20; ++i) std::cout << (r.Boolean() ? "H" : "T");
00046     std::cout << "\n";
00047   }
00048   std::cout << "Generate 20 random bits: " << r.Bits<20>() << "\n";
00049   {
00050     std::cout << "Throwing a pair of dice 15 times:";
00051     for (size_t i = 0; i < 15; ++i)
00052       std::cout << " " << r.IntegerC(1,6) + r.IntegerC(1,6);
00053     std::cout << "\n";
00054   }
00055   {
00056     // Weights for throwing a pair of dice
00057     unsigned w[] = { 0, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 };
00058     // Initialize selection
00059     RandomLib::RandomSelect<unsigned> sel(w, w + sizeof(w)/sizeof(unsigned));
00060     std::cout << "A different way of throwing dice:";
00061     for (size_t i = 0; i < 15; ++i) std::cout << " " << sel(r);
00062     std::cout << "\n";
00063   }
00064   {
00065     std::cout << "Draw balls from urn containing 5 red and 5 white balls: ";
00066     int t = 10, w = 5;
00067     while (t) std::cout << (r.Prob(w, t--) ? w--, "W" : "R");
00068     std::cout << "\n";
00069   }
00070   {
00071     std::cout << "Shuffling the letters a..z: ";
00072     std::string digits = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";
00073     std::random_shuffle(digits.begin(), digits.end(), r);
00074     std::cout << digits << "\n";
00075   }
00076   {
00077     std::cout << "Estimate mean and variance of normal distribution: ";
00078     double m = 0, s = 0;
00079     int k = 0;
00080     RandomLib::NormalDistribution<> n;
00081     while (k < 10000) {
00082       double x = n(r), m1 = m + (x - m)/++k;
00083       s += (x - m) * (x - m1); m = m1;
00084     }
00085     std::cout << m << ", " << s/(k - 1) << "\n";
00086   }
00087   {
00088     typedef float real;
00089     enum { prec = 4 };
00090     std::cout << "Some low precision reals (1/" << (1<<prec) << "):";
00091     for (size_t i = 0; i < 5; ++i) std::cout << " " << r.Fixed<real, prec>();
00092     std::cout << "\n";
00093   }
00094   std::cout << "Used " << r.Count() << " random numbers\n";
00095   try {
00096     // This throws an error if there's a problem
00097     RandomLib::MRandom32::SelfTest();
00098     std::cout << "Self test of " << RandomLib::MRandom32::Name()
00099               << " passed\n";
00100     RandomLib::MRandom64::SelfTest();
00101     std::cout << "Self test of " << RandomLib::MRandom64::Name()
00102               << " passed\n";
00103     RandomLib::SRandom32::SelfTest();
00104     std::cout << "Self test of " << RandomLib::SRandom32::Name()
00105               << " passed\n";
00106     RandomLib::SRandom64::SelfTest();
00107     std::cout << "Self test of " << RandomLib::SRandom64::Name()
00108               << " passed\n";
00109   }
00110   catch (std::out_of_range& e) {
00111     std::cerr << "Self test FAILED: " << e.what() << "\n";
00112     return 1;
00113   }
00114   return 0;
00115 }
